means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 克鲁克来源于克诺斯语人名，含义是“弯曲部”(crook,bend)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 克鲁克地貌名称，河流或道路拐弯处，或职业名称，制造、出售或使用钩者，来源于古诺斯语，含义是“弯曲部”(crook,bend)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"弯，弯曲"之意。
means: curve ： 指变成曲线或弧线状的动作或状态。
bend ： 普通用词，指把某物变成曲线或角形。用于人时，指头部或身躯弯下。
bow ： 指把头部或上身弯向前方的动作，也指社交中的礼节性动作。
crook ： 指不规则的弯曲，也指按照规则或模型弯曲某物。
twist ： 指通过转动、拧或扭使某物成弯曲状。

sentence.Network_en: In his preoccupation with Robyn, Crook had neglected everything.
sentence.Network_cn: 克鲁克一心想着罗宾，忽略了其他一切事情。

sentence.Network_en: Crook had resigned his post rather than be party to such treachery.
sentence.Network_cn: 克鲁克已经辞职了，不愿参与这种背信弃义的行为。

sentence.Network_en: "We supply financial information to selected clients," Crook said loftily.
sentence.Network_cn: “我们的金融信息服务对象是经过挑选的客户，”克鲁克傲慢地说道。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新编大学英语单词表(第一册) - 豆丁网 ... crest n. 顶部， 顶 crook n. 骗子， 窃贼 daybreak n. 黎明.
建筑英语词汇大全（正宗翻译） - 豆丁网 ... continuous layer board 多层板3 crook 弯曲木 cross rail 拉档5.
《单词寻根记忆魔法》 ... creek 小溪（弯的） crook 钩状物（弯的） feed 喂养.
职称英语A级词汇 - 豆丁网 ... crocodile n. 鳄鱼 crook n. 钩；弯曲 crude a. 天然的；粗糙的，粗鲁的 n.原材料.

lj.lj_ly: you’re crook on me because I didn't walk out with you.
lj.lj_ls: 你对我生气因为我没有和你一起出去。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (澳／新西兰， 非正式)发脾气

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'hooked tool or weapon'): from Old Norse krókr 'hook'. A noun sense 'deceit, guile, trickery' (compare with crooked) was recorded in Middle English but was obsolete by the 17th cent

entry.def: A crook is a dishonest person or a criminal.

example.ex: The man is a crook and a liar...
example.tran: 那人是个骗子，满嘴谎言。

example.ex: Donaldson was a petty crook with a string of previous offences.
example.tran: 唐纳森有一系列小的犯罪前科，但没犯过大事。

entry.def: The crook of your arm or leg is the soft inside part where you bend your elbow or knee.

example.ex: She hid her face in the crook of her arm.

entry.def: If you crook your arm or finger, you bend it.

example.ex: He crooked his finger: 'Come forward,' he said.

entry.def: A crook is a long pole with a large hook at the end. A crook is carried by a bishop in religious ceremonies, or by a shepherd.
If someone says they will do something by hook or by crook, they are determined to do it, even if they have to make a great effort or use dishonest means.

example.ex: They intend to get their way, by hook or by crook.
example.tran: 为达到目的，他们不择手段。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who has committed (or been legally convicted of) a crime
2. a circular segment of a curve;
3. a long staff with one end being hook shaped

auth_sentence.content: How to tell a crook from someone sin-cere.
auth_sentence.res_content: How to tell a crook from someone sin-cere.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How to tell a crook from someone sin-cere.

auth_sentence.content: The crook had better hope the cops get there first.
auth_sentence.res_content: The crook had better hope the cops get there first.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The crook had better hope the cops get there first.

auth_sentence.content: Extreme crookedness insures extreme loyalty to another crook, he reasons.
auth_sentence.res_content: Extreme crookedness insures extreme loyalty to another crook, he reasons.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Extreme crookedness insures extreme loyalty to another crook, he reasons.

sentences.en: She lay curled up in the crook of his arm.
She was cradling a small parcel in the crook of her elbow.
sentences.cn: 她用手臂挎着一个小包裹。

sentences.en: He demanded an apology from me for calling him a crook.
sentences.cn: 我骂他骗子,他要我向他认错。

sentences.en: The new mayor promised to clean the crooks out of the city government.
sentences.cn: 新上任的市长答应肃清市政府中的不良分子。

sentences.en: Don’t hazard your reputation by supporting that crook.
sentences.cn: 不要冒败坏你名声的危险去支持那个坏蛋。

sentences.en: The police are getting after the crooks in the city.
Don’t worry—we’ll have the money ready by 4 o’clock, by hook or by crook.
sentences.cn: 别担心—我们会想尽一切办法在4点钟前把钱准备好。

sentences.en: She crooked her finger to beckon him.
He crooked a finger to tell us to go over to him.
sentences.cn: 他弯了弯手指，示意我们到他那儿去。
